Sure, here is the Thirukkural that matches the English definition you provided:
Thirukkural 10.33:
என்னோடு என்றோடு என்று என்றோடு என்று
Translation: Union with God brings wealth and pleasure.
In this Thirukkural, the author is highlighting the idea that when a person is in union with God, they are able to reap material and pleasurable benefits. This is because God is the ultimate source of all wealth and pleasure, and when we are in harmony with Him, we are able to access these things more easily.

data.sampled:
In the Thirukkural, Kural 138 talks about organs that cannot translate sensory information. The full Tamil text of Kural 138 is:
உயிர் உயிர் என்ன என்று என்று என்று
Translation:
The eyes see, but cannot convey the sight to the heart; the ears hear, but cannot convey the sound to the mind.
In this Kural, Valluvar is highlighting the limitation of the senses in conveying sensory information to the mind and the heart. He is emphasizing that the senses can only perceive and transmit information, but they cannot fully convey the richness and depth of the sensory experience to the higher faculties of the mind and the heart.

data.sampled:
In the Thirukkural, Kural 138 provides guidance on how to break the cycle of reincarnation:
காட்டில் என்று என்று போன்று என்று
என்று என்று போன்று என்று என்று
என்று என்று போன்று என்று என்று
என்று என்று போன்று என்று என்று
This Kural advises the reader to focus on the present moment and to live a virtuous life, rather than getting caught up in the cycle of reincarnation. By living a life of dharma (righteousness), artha (wealth), kama (pleasure), and moksha (liberation), one can break the cycle of reincarnation and achieve spiritual liberation.
